Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: broken maeander pattern around rim above dot and billet band; below, from left: pendant corner ornament; dividing band of vertical maeander between two pairs of lines; maeander squares.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, as the sherds from this group display patterns on the different parts of the vessel which are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 72, p. 236 no. 160, pl. 15) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.478L)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0144) (phase 2)
